String.text: There is a newer version available: {0}
Something went wrong, see log files for details.

Messageboxes.Messagebox:
Do you want to create a backup before applying all changes?
Press "Yes" to create a backup and save. Press "No" to save without backup. Press "Cancel" to abort.
Changes have been applied. You may start the game now.
Please pick your game edition under the Settings tab.
Please run the game first before using this tool. The game will generate those files on first start-up.
Some values have been reset to default. Only unstable values from previous versions are affected. Don't forget to click 'Apply'.

*.ini files have been modified outside of the tool while it's running. NOTE: Any changes will be overwritten, if clicked on "Apply" or if mods are managed. Please restart the tool to work with the new values.

{0} exception(s) occured while the UI was loaded. This might be caused by corrupted ini files. Some UI elements might not be functioning correctly.
{1}

{0} *.ini value(s) are invalid:
{1}
Downloaded language files: {0}
Downloading languages failed. {0}
Switching to or from the Microsoft Store edition requires a restart of the tool.
Unfortunately, it's not possible to launch the executable directly due to "security" restrictions. Thanks Microsoft, we hate it. :(
At least one of your custom *.ini files contains an error. {0}

Messagebox.title: Display resolution might be too low

Messageboxes.Messagebox: A restart of the tool is required for changes to take effect. Are you sure, you want to change this option now?
You are about to delete '{0}'. Are you sure?
You are about to delete {0} files. Are you sure?
Are you sure you want to delete the gallery's thumbnails? The next time you click on 'Refresh gallery', it will take significantly longer as it recreates all thumbnails.
You can now launch into Adventure mode.
You can now launch into Nuclear Winter mode.
Mods have been disabled and removed from the game.
Mods are deployed.
Mods might not be deployed. Please check the log files.
.\Archive2\Archive2.exe is missing. Please download this tool again, or install Archive2 manually.
Please set the path to the game (where Fallout76.exe resides).
Wrong game folder path.
Directory {0} does not exist. Please restart the mod manager and add the mod again.
The root folder has to be set to ".\Data" for mods, that are to be installed as a *.ba2 archive. Please fix the "Install into" setting and try again.
Are you sure you want to delete the mod {0}?
Are you sure you want to delete {0} mods?
Please uncompress the archive and add the mod as a folder.
{0} files are not supported. Please uncompress the archive and add the mod as a folder.
No conflicting files found.
For this action, you have to deploy all mods first.
You haven't deployed the changes you made. Are you sure you want to close the mod manager?
The path {0} does not exist. The mod folder was removed without removing the entry in the manifest.
A mod entry is invalid and was ignored. Error: {0}
The <Mods> tag has invalid attributes. Error: {0}
Are you sure you want to add mods installed outside of the mod manager?
Some mods have the same archive name: "{0}". Conflicting mod name: {1}
Managed mod folder couldn't be renamed. Error message: "{0}".
This will attempt to repair all *.dds files. It can take a long time, depending on file size and number of files. Are you sure you want to continue?
*.dds files have been repaired.
{0} Please start the tool as admin and try again.

Messagebox.title: Would you like to repack bundled archives?

Messageboxes.Messagebox:
There are frozen bundled archives available. Would you like to repack bundled archives again?
Yes - I made changes to my mod list and would like to repack my bundled archives again. (slow)
No - I didn't make changes, please deploy my frozen bundled archives. (quick)
You've enabled the Nuclear Winter mode, but your mods are still deployed. Do you want to disable them now?

Messagebox.title: Do you want to re-enable your mods again?

Messageboxes.Messagebox: You've disabled the Nuclear Winter mode, but your mods are still disabled. Do you want to deploy them now?
Mod information updated and thumbnails downloaded.
Couldn't update your profile: {0}
Do you really want to delete all thumbnails?
Thumbnails deleted.
Thumbnails couldn't be deleted. Try again later.
Do you really want to remove your profile from the mod manager?
Profile removed.
Do you really want to remove mod information?
Mod information removed.

Label.text: This language is out-dated.\nSome elements might not be translated yet.
Fallout 76 cannot be run directly, if installed through the Microsoft Store.
Tip: Enter your login credentials under the "General" tab.

RadioButton.text: Launch via Steam / Bethesda.net / MS Store (recommended)

CheckBox.Tooltip: Puts tweaks into Fallout76.ini and Fallout76Prefs.ini instead. Does not affect the mod manager. You may need to remove tweaks from Fallout76Custom.ini manually.

This will deny write permission to the "Fallout 76" folder. Use this, if the read-only option doesn't work.
Affected folder: %UserProfile%\Documents\My Games\Fallout 76

CheckBox.text: I use more than one game edition.
CheckBox.Tooltip: Check this, if you're modding more than one game edition. If checked, sResourceIndexFileList will be saved for every game edition separately.

This option will make all *.ini files read-only immediately. Enable this if your settings get reverted.
Affected files: %UserProfile%\Documents\My Games\Fallout 76\*.ini

CheckBox.text: Close the tool when the game is launched
CheckBox.Tooltip: Does only work when the game is launched through the tool.

CheckBox.text: Don't ask me, when "Apply" is clicked.
CheckBox.Tooltip: Skips the backup question when "Apply" is clicked. Note: This way, it will NOT create a backup!

CheckBox.text: Automatically apply changes when tool is closed or game is launched.
CheckBox.Tooltip: No need to press apply anymore.

Label.text: This tool allows you to quickly tweak INI settings.\nTip: Hover over an option, if you're unsure what it does.

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowFloatingQuestText Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bShowDamageNumbers Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bShowPublicTeamNotifications Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bShowOtherPlayersNames Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bShowFloatingQuestMarkers Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnablePowerArmorHUD Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnableItemRarityColors Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip: Affected values: uHUDActiveEffectWidget Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowDamageNumbers Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip: Affected values: fFloatingQuestMarkersDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bCrosshairEnabled Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bShowCompass Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip: Affected values: fHUDOpacity Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bEnableQuestAutoTrackOther Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnableQuestAutoTrackEvent Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnableQuestAutoTrackMisc Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnableQuestAutoTrackSide Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bEnableQuestAutoTrackMain Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.text: Show splash screen with news on startup
CheckBox.Tooltip:
If unchecked, the game won't bother you with news on startup.
Affected values: bShowSplash Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

When this option is unchecked, the game will start without displaying the Bethesda logo video.
Affected values: sIntroSequence, uMainMenuDelayBeforeAllowSkip Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Enabling this will skip the login prompt if you provide your login credentials.
Affected values: bAutoSignin Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: bSteamEnabled Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.text:
Your credentials are saved into Fallout76Custom.ini
This way, you don't have to enter your username and password manually
if you start Fallout 76 without the launcher.

If you use Steam and want to use your Bethesda.net account
(e.g. to spent Atoms), tick Disable Steam.
NOTE: Your achievements will be disabled as well!

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Sharpens the image.
Default: 0.2 Recommended: 0.4
Affected values: fTAAPostSharpen Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Sharpens the image.
Recommended: 0.2 Default: 0.2
Affected values: fTAAPostOverlay Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Reduces aliasing by blurring edges of objects.
TAA - Temporal Anti-Aliasing: Relatively expensive, default FXAA - Fast Approximate Anti-Aliasing: Slightly improves performance, aliasing slightly visible Off - Improves performance, aliasing clearly visible
NOTE: For some reason FXAA doesn't work. The game just disables AA entirely. Atleast for me.
Default: TAA Affected values: sAntiAliasing Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Sets the distance grass will begin to fade.
Medium is 4500 High is 5500 Ultra is 7000
Affected values: fGrassStartFadeDistance, fGrassMinStartFadeDistance, fGrassMaxStartFadeDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
Enables/disables the grass ingame.
Affected values: bAllowCreateGrass Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Sets the distance actors (=Players, NPCs) will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultActors Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Sets the distance items will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultItems Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Sets the distance objects will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultObjects Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
Unchecking this will uncap the frame rate.
Enable this if you experience screen tearing. Disable this if you experience input lag.
Please note: Cap the game to 60 FPS manually. (e.g. using NVIDIA's Control Panel)
Default: Enabled Affected values: iPresentInterval Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Unchecking this will disable godrays.
Affected values: bVolumetricLightingEnable Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Reduces aliasing of textures when viewed from oblique angles.
Default: 8 Affected values: iMaxAnisotropy Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Distance at which the game will transition to lower-res a shadow "segment". MUST be a multiple of 12.
Affected values: fBlendSplitDirShadow Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Amount of "segments" of lower-res shadows at a distance. A value of 1 forces the game to render only the lowest resolution shadows.
Affected values: iDirShadowSplits Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Sets the distance that shadows are rendered.
Ultra is 150000 High is 120000 Medium is 90000 Low is 60000
I think, setting it to a low value will disable shadows. Needs more testing.
Affected values: fShadowDistance, fDirShadowDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Blurs shadows. Especially useful, if you set a lower shadow resolution.
Affected values: uiOrthoShadowFilter Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Resolution of shadows. Higher settings will make shadows more detailed.
Affected values: iShadowMapResolution Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
Enables/disables water displacement (ripples, waves).
Affected values: bUseWaterDisplacements Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bFogEnabled Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Toggles environmental and clothing wetness occlusion
Affected values: bWetnessOcclusion Affected files: Fallout76.ini

When checked, rain won't be rendered around your character if you're beneath an elevated highway or in a building, and rain drops and splashes won't be rendered on the floor.
Affected values: bRainOcclusion Affected files: Fallout76.ini

Unchecking this will disable ambient occlusion. Ambient occlusion basically adds fake shadows to places light sources can't reach (concave edges).
Affected values: bSAOEnable Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Unchecking this will disable all Depth of Field effects.
Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini Affected values: bDynamicDepthOfField fDOFBlendRatio fDOFMinFocalCoefDist fDOFMaxFocalCoefDist fDOFDynamicFarRange fDOFCenterWeightInt fDOFFarDistance

Blurs moving objects when turning the camera.
Affected values: bMBEnable Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Blurs the screen when the player is hurt (e.g. hit by bullets) or under water. Unchecking this might result in a clear view underwater.
Affected values: bDoRadialBlur, iRadialBlurLevel Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Unchecking this will disable Lens Flare.
Affected values: bLensFlare Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Fixes hidden / borked * lock picking screen and * Power Armor HUD for 5:4 and 4:3 screens.
Mostly untested.
Affected values: fLockPositionY, fUIPowerArmorGeometry_TranslateZ, fUIPowerArmorGeometry_TranslateY Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.Tooltip: Set resolution to "Custom" for this option to become available.

CheckBox.Tooltip:
Disable this if you want the game to pause if another window is in front.
Affected values: bAlwaysActive Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the resolution. Setting it to "Custom" will allow you to set your own values.
Affected values: iSize W, iSize H Affected files: Fallout76Prefsini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
Checking this will keep the game's window in foreground. NOTE: This will prevent you from being able to Alt+Tab on single monitors.
Affected values: bTopMostWindow Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

NumericUpDown.Tooltip:
Changes the horizontal resolution (width).
Affected values: iSize W

Changes the vertical resolution (height).
Affected values: iSize H

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the display mode.
Fullscreen: Real fullscreen mode
Windowed: Windowed mode with border
Borderless windowed: Make sure, the resolution matches your display's resolution.
Borderless windowed (Fullscreen): Window will be maximized to fit your screen. Looks pixelated (it uses Nearest Neighbor), if the resolution is low.
Affected values: bFull Screen, bBorderless Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bEnableAudio Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

If unchecked, the game won't play background music in the main menu.
Affected values: bPlayMainMenuMusic Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: bVoicePushToTalkEnabled Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Changes the volume of the voice chat.
Affected values: uVivoxVoiceVolume Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal6.
Affected values: fVal6 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal5.
Affected values: fVal5 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal4.
Affected values: fVal4 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal3.
Affected values: fVal3 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal2.
Affected values: fVal2 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal1.
Affected values: fVal1 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the overall volume of the game.
Affected values: fAudioMasterVolume Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the volume of fVal0.
Affected values: fVal0 Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: fConversationHistorySize Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowDialogueHistory Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bDialogueSubtitles Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bGeneralSubtitles Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Uncheck this, if you have a gamepad plugged in, but want to use your keyboard and mouse instead. Leave this checked otherwise.
Affected values: bGamepadEnable Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Enables rumbling (force feedback) of your gamepad.
Affected values: bGamePadRumble Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: bInvertXValues Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bInvertYValues Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Mouse sensitivity
Affected values: fMouseHeadingSensitivity, fMouseHeadingSensitivityY Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
This option might not have any effect. Placebo? Doesn't hurt to turn it off, though.
Affected values: bMouseAcceleration Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

If checked, the aim sensitivity will be equal to normal sensitivity. If unchecked (default), the sensitivity will be lower when aiming down iron sights.
Note: This might only work on 16:9 monitors. If it works for you on an other monitor (e.g. 21:9), please let me know.
Note 2: This might not work in-game while crouching.
Affected values: fIronSightsFOVRotateMult Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

If checked, the sensitivity for looking up/down and left/right will be equal. If unchecked (default), the sensitivity for looking left/right will likely be higher than up/down.
When checked, your mouse sensitivity might increase.
The sensitivity depends on your display's aspect ratio: For 4:3, the value of X is .028 For 16:9, the value of X is .03738 For 16:10, the value of X is .0336 For 21:9, the value of X is .042
Default: Disabled (.021 for both) Affected values: fMouseHeadingXScale, fMouseHeadingYScale, fPitchSpeedRatio, fIronSightsPitchSpeedRatio Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.Tooltip: Affected values: f1st3rdSwitchDelay Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

By how much the camera gets zoomed out when you look at the ground in 3rd person.
Affected values: fPitchZoomOutMaxDist Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fVanityModeMaxDist Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fVanityModeMinDist Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
When disabled, sets the camera's position into the characters head. You'll need to zoom out in third person. If enabled, sets the camera's position behind the right shoulder.
Might cause issues.
Default: Enabled Affected values: bApplyCameraNodeAnimations Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Causes issues with the GUI.
Default: 80 Affected values: fDefaultFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Changes the field of view of the 3rd person perspective while aiming.
Default: 50 Affected values: f3rdPersonAimFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Changes the field of view of the 3rd person perspective.
Default: 80 Affected values: fDefaultWorldFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini, Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the field of view of the 1st person perspective.
Default: 80 Affected values: fDefault1stPersonFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini, Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip: Affected values: bForceAutoVanityMode Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

When this option is checked, the camera will spin around the character after no input was given for a certain amount of time. Not sure if it does anything, though. I stood around for 5 minutes and the camera didn't spin. Needs more testing.
Affected values: bDisableAutoVanityMode Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.text: These settings affect both the Pipboy and the Quickboy.

NumericUpDown.Tooltip:
Changes the resolution height of the Pipboy/Quickboy.
Affected values: uPipboyTargetHeight Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the resolution width of the Pipboy/Quickboy.
Affected values: uPipboyTargetWidth Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

RadioButton.Tooltip: Affected values: bQuickboyMode Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bQuickboyMode Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the color of the Pip-Boy which is accessed from the Power Armor.
Affected values: fPAEffectColorR, fPAEffectColorG, fPAEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fQuickBoyEffectColorR, fQuickBoyEffectColorG, fQuickBoyEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fPipboyEffectColorR, fPipboyEffectColorG, fPipboyEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.text: Click 'Refresh gallery' to display screenshots and photos.

Label.Tooltip:
When you take screenshots ingame with the print screen button, it saves them in the game directory as "ScreenShotX.png". The "X" being the screenshot index.
Affected values: iScreenShotIndex Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

CheckBox.Tooltip:
If you 'freeze' an archive, it does not get recreated when deploying. This will speed up deployment.
This is especially useful, if the archive is HUGE (1GiB or more) and the files aren't changing.

Label.text: Installation options are disabled, because the mod is frozen.
NOTE: Frozen mods will be ignored.

CheckBox.Tooltip: Instead of rebuilding bundled archives, it will save a bundled copy and ask you if you want to update it on deploy.

CheckBox.text: Make hard links instead of copying files manually (recommended)
CheckBox.Tooltip: Reduces disk space and deployment time.

Label.text:
The mod manager can retrieve mod version and thumbnail via the NexusMods API for you.
To access the API, you'll need to provide your personal API key.

Your personal API key will be stored locally and will be used for the following purposes:
- retrieving mod information, such as name, version, and thumbnails
- displaying some account information, such as user name, profile picture, account status, and rate limit
- show if updates are available

Since your personal API key is linked to your account, NEVER share the key with any other user, or app you don't trust.

I'm not affiliated with NexusMods. This feature is unofficial and uses the public API.
